item.title: Report X-2025030433
item.description:
Report X-2025030433

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CAME TO OUR WORKSTATION AND SAID THERE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT AT THE IRREG/HAZMAT SORT ROLLER. AT THE SORT ROLLER RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH BOTH 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS ON THE FLOOR WITH SOME LIQUID. THE PACKAGE AND THE LEAKED CONTENTS WERE CLEANED UP AND TAKEN BACK TO THE DMP FOR INSPECTION AND PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025030097
item.description:
Report E-2025030097

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: SHAKOPEE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5515
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 5 gallons of gasoline to be released. EX Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025030184
item.description:
Report X-2025030184

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS TRIBUNE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UTLX 952548 was found leaking in the Northtown, MN Railyard Yard on 02/07/25. After inspection it was determined UTLX 952548 was leaking from the Liquid valve due to the valve being open and the plug loose. The BNSF Responder closed the valve, tighten the plug and released it to final destination.
